content: AMA SG Young Investment Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 11 Sep 2018Whenever you buy individual stocks, what is the information and the news that you will research on or take note of?Not sure how to determine if a stock is considered good, or whether it has potential to rise1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Soh Sing Heng, Financial Blogger at SG Young InvestmentLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 11 Sep 2018I will always start by reading its annual report to read what the management says and then scan through their financial statements to check on its profitability, debt profile and also its cash flow. I will dissect a company's business and go into detail on all its businesses and its contribution to the group. Then I will also look at its risk against the current economic situation. â€‹An example is the analysis I did on Singtel here: http://sgyounginvestment.blogspot.com/2018/07/looking-more-closely-at-singtel-is.html0 comments0
